description: Armcord works good as discord's alternative client for Arch Linux. Needs to be improved at tray plugin when you aren't turning Tray feature on, armcord will just sit at the background when closed. Still resolvable via killing process/logout though.

A very good app, especially considering how easy it makes integrating custom clients and mods into an otherwise normal Discord experience. This is to Discord as the extension manager is to GNOME.

The project's roots in making a Discord client for ARM is also really impressive, and the fact that the devs are basically porting a native ARM app to x86-64 (when, often times, the exact opposite is the situation for projects) is really kind of them.

My only deal breaker is that, as of writing (2023-04-01), the current version as of writing (3.1.7) crashes when the user presses the screenshare button in a vc. Other than that though, great app!
Absolutely pheonemenal. Makes the process installing themes and plugins much easier, as well as being a generally improved client across the board. Highly recommend!
summary: Incredible Discord client with Mod Support

description: It's a neat client but the biggest drawback for me is how the client crashes every time I try to share my screen. No configuration fixes this.
webcord can...

This is a great Discord client that has worked wonderfully for me. It's great on system resources (Being designed to work on ARM) and it has built in support for various mods.

Some issues I've noticed on other clients that ArmCord doesn't have
- Lack of hardware acceleration (Official client)
- Inability to remember login (GTKCord and occasionally WebCord and Discord-Screenaudio. I've seen a review saying that ARMCord has issues with this, stating that WebCord doesn't have this issue, but I've had the exact opposite experience from them)
-Crashing on app startup (Both WebCord and Discord-Screenaudio have had updates that have caused the app to crash when attempting to launch it)
-Inability to maximize on vertical monitor (Official client)

Things I love about this client:
-Extremely reliable
-Great performance
-Incredibly easy to install mods and extensions

To be honest, the only thing I dislike about ArmCord, and this seems to be an issue with most Linux clients with there even being a client dedicated to solving this issue, is that you can't do a screenshare with audio, which I noticed when I tried to watch a TV show with some friends through the client.
Everything works
Developers tend to release unstable builds that just constantly crash on launch which means I am unable to use Discord
Title says it all.
Cannot finish setup due to constant crash on Fedora 38 (using stable version)

I have found this app to be far easier to install and configure than betterdiscord and it hasn't had any real issues in the week or so I have used it. 

The only minor issue I have had is that I can't seem to get the app icon to change to the traditional discord icon. The Armcord logo/icon is hideous.
nothing wrong here

- Was having some issues with webcord so tried this and I love it!
- feels faster than webcord for some reason.
Works well, a few bugs here and there sometimes, but a better choice than the official Discord client

Just installed it and it works great and runs way smoother than the original Discord Client. On Wayland the UI Flickers from Black to Normal as soon as you focus another App. But idc because I use Xorg on my PC anyways

Using Armcord with Nobara is definitely a fairly okay experience, but there are some features left out by the app, like the right click to copy or open a link. Vesktop does let you do this. However if you're more of a power user you will like the Performance preset in the settings tab.
summary: It's fine, needs some more work

description: The best Discord client on Flathub. Works nicely on Pinephone. Fast enough, doesn't crash. What more could you want?

Overal it works great, the only issue im running into is that the wayland video bridge conflicts with armcords build in screenshare fix. it opens the window selection screen multiple times, and only sometimes actually works ( when you select the same window on both popups)
Tiene detalles menores, como no usar la presencia rica o que las imagenes se descarguen como WEBP, pero más allá de eso lo veo más completo que sus equivalentes de Android.
Bonne application qui permet de retrouver Discord comme on le connaît et surtout sans problème d'affichage
summary: Fonctionne mieux que le client original
